PRESS Pontiac, Michigan April 8, 1955
Tobacco Group Offers Grants
Hape Fellowship Plan Will Stimulate Interest Among. Med Students
NEW YORK (INS)-A fellowship program "to stimulate interest in research among medical school students" was announced today by Timothy V. Hartnett, chairman of the Tobacco Industry Research Committee. P
The fellowships are intended for regular or graduate students inter -; ested in devoting their summer or "off-terin"the"to basic research in experimental or clinical sel- ences, Haftnett said. Each fellow -. ship will provide $500 for the term. .
The fellowship program war recommended by the Scientifio Advisory Board, a group of nine doctors 'and scientists determin- ing research polley and programa for the "Tobacco Industry ke-" search Committee which"slent gaged ht the seay" of ranged. connections between toboer and
""The program is designeas introduce students, to . reza early in their scientific careers, Dr. Littlegidde "Nowlimitation of any kind is placed upon the field of research which may be selected within areas designated."
He said recipients of the fellow- ships will be selected by the_deans of the medical schools and that all applicants must be qualified, fo : undertake summer or "off-term" programs in the laboratories of experienced investigators
DAILY MIRROR New York, New York April 8, 1955
NEW YORK WORLD-TELEGRAM & SC New York, New York April 8, 1955
Offer Fellowships To Push Research
A fellowship program "to stimu- late interest in research among medical school students" was announced here .Thursday by Timothy V. Hartnett, chairman of the Tobacco Industry Research Committee.
The fellowships 'are intended for regular or graduate students interested in devoting their Sum- mer or "off-term" time to basic research in experimental or clini- cal sciences, Hartnett jaid. Each fellowship will provide $500 for the term. The program was rec- omended by the Scientific Ad- visory Board, a group of nine doctors and scientists determining' research policy and program for the Tobacco Industry Research Committee which is engaged in the study of alleged connections between tobacco and lung cancer.
Clinie Fellowships Set for Students
Students in - medical school are eligible for $500 fellowships to do basic research in experi- mental or clinical sciences, ac- cording to an announcement today by Timothy V. Hartnett, chairman of the Tobacco In- dustry Research. Committee .. ]
They will te picked by the deans of their schools. The fel- lowships are intended for regu- lar or graduate students inter. ested in working during the summer or whenever else they have free time, The committee, has set aside sys(00 for these TENourshing In 195

NEW YORK (INS)-A fellowship program "to stimulate interest in research among medical school students" was announced today by Timothy V. Hartnett, chairman of the Tobacco Industry Research Committee. P

The fellowships are intended for regular or graduate students inter -; ested in devoting their summer or "off-terin"the"to basic research in experimental or clinical sel- ences, Haftnett said. Each fellow -. ship will provide $500 for the term. .
